title: Eric Sardinas - Audio & Video Compilation
description:
Eric Sardinas - Audio and Video Compilation

i won&#039;t be seeding this too long.  i&#039;ll wait for some seeds, then i gotta clean off the hd.

since the entire web is void eric sardinas torrents at the moment, i thought i&#039;d package these up for a torrent.
--------------
VIDEO:

all the vids came from emule, no lineage, no txt files.
i&#039;m including the original vid files as well as all the vids packed into a playable pal dvd.  i used ConvertXtoDVD to make the video_ts folder.


1. Milan, 2-19-2005, full show, ~65 min, AUD Cam, avi
2. Black Pearls movie, ~7 min, avi
3. Slide Blues Force [young guitar] (guitar lessons), ~9 min, mpg
4. with Steve Vai, London Astoria - The Attitude Song, ~12 min, avi
5. Flames of Love - Tv3, horrible vid quality, ~6 min, mpg
6. Bilbao, 9-11-2005, 6 pics and a few avi clips (but only one 30 sec clip is included on the dvd.  aslo, one of these was used for the dvd menu pic.)


!!  DVD WARNING  !!  LOSSY SOURCES  !!
DVD PAL
100 min
Simple Menu, titled but without chapters
authored by thebc

screenshots of the menu and the Milan 2-19-05 show are in the torrent.

Video Attribute :
  Video compression mode : MPEG-2
  TV system : 625/50 (PAL)
  Aspect Ratio : 4:3
  Display Mode : Both Pan-scan and Letterbox
  Source picture resolution : 720x576 (625/50)
  Frame Rate : 25.00
  Source picture letterboxed : Not letterboxed
  Bitrate : 8.81Mbps
Audio Attribute : 
  Audio Coding mode : Dolby Digital
  Sampling Rate : 48kHz
  Audio application mode : Not specified
  Number of Audio channels : 2
  Bitrate : 192 Kbps
  Number of Audio streams : 1


this was my first time using ConvertXtoDVD.  i needed a program that could combine all these different files quickly into a dvd.  i made the dvd for myself, but the program ended up working great and made a decent dvd, so i&#039;m sharing that too.  i was unsure it would work since all the vid files used were different dimensions, some ntsc, some pal, and all sorts of other complications.  imagine converting each file individually to dvd-compliant mpeg-2 files, and then getting them to author correctly in TMPGEncDVDAuthor.  sounds like a bitch, eh?  it is for me, i&#039;m no expert in these conversions, but i&#039;ve fiddled with a few like TMPGEnc XPress, TMPGEnc Plus, Super, and Cucusoft Converter Pro.
--------------
Audio:

Cologne, 09-29-2005, downloaded from emule as one big wav, unknown source.
i split it into 11 tracks w/ audacity, then flac&#039;d em.
unknown setlist, no txt file.
Lineage: ? > big wav from emule > audacity, split tracks > flac8
flacs by thebc

and these 2 flac shows i&#039;ve had for a while:
